posts.post_content: Let me explain: This card used to be necessary so people could use [Wild Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Growth) without worrying about mana burn if they cast a 1 cmc spell. But now with mana burn gone this card is less useful.

posts.post_content:
Quite obviously the best card ever. It works great with [Gleemax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gleemax), [Sliver Queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sliver Queen), [Blaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blaze), [Clockwork Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clockwork Dragon), and so many others I couldn't dream of mentioning them all by name. Not to mention that it makes those really annoying cards like [Scald](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scald) obsolete.  
  
Of course, it has one **huge** downside. If that card is tapped and it gets destroyed, you better have some backup plan or you'll be losing infinity life due to mana burn.... Of course, I like to make a distinction between "infinite" (infinity - infinity = 0) and "virtually infinite" (infinity - virtually infinity = infinity) so that I can spend all that mana on something just in case. Sometimes your friends will let you play like that, but I'm not sure how the official rules would look on that.  
  
One card combo especially worth mentioning: Put an [Essence Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Sliver), a [Sliver Queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sliver Queen), and a Magma Sl... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Quite obviously the best card ever. It works great with Gleemax, Sliver Queen, Blaze, Clockwork Dragon, and so many others I couldn't dream of mentioning them all by name. Not to mention that it makes those really annoying cards like Scald obsolete.

Of course, it has one huge downside. If that card is tapped and it gets destroyed, you better have some backup plan or you'll be losing infinity life due to mana burn.... Of course, I like to make a distinction between "infinite" (infinity - infinity = 0) and "virtually infinite" (infinity - virtually infinity = infinity) so that I can spend all that mana on something just in case. Sometimes your friends will let you play like that, but I'm not sure how the official rules would look on that.
